availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Stokes (Louisville, Kentucky, merchant and saddler)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant and saddler. New York, New York, native. Son of John Stokes and Christina Stokes. Married to Prudence Catherine Ward Stokes in Jefferson County, Kentucky on June 27, 1833. Father of Ellen Stokes Shippen, Mary Frances Stokes Marshall, Sarah Jane Stokes, Arthur Henry Stokes, Emma Prudence Stokes, Alice Catherine Stokes Harrison, Albert William Stokes. Merchant in Louisville in 1850. Owned two enslaved women in Louisville in 1850. Saddler in Louisville in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
